title: A Chemist Lifting with Extreme Precaution the Cuticle of a Grand Piano

thumbnail.alt_text: In a stark desert landscape, an older man sits in the foreground, illuminated, with a newspaper. Arranged evenly across the land behind him, smaller than perspective would indicate, are a faded child holding a hula hoop, a man holding a melting piano, a standing woman, and a figure near the horizon.

inscriptions: Signed and dated, l.r.: "Gala Salvador Dali 1936"
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph R. Shapiro
publication_history:
Souvenir–Catalogue, exh. cat. (New York: Julien Levy Gallery, 1936), cat. 8 (ill.). 

Marcia Winn, “Surrealist is Mystified by His Own Art,” Chicago Daily Tribune (Jan. 24, 1937), 17. 

John Menaugh, "Art Dreamlines Mae West!" Chicago Sunday Tribune, (June 26, 1938), 4 (ill.).

Daniel Catton Rich, Loan Exhibition of Modern Paintings and Drawings from Private Collections in Chicago, exh. cat. (Chicago: Arts Club of Chicago, 1938), cat. 20, as Physician Lifting with Extreme Precaution the Cuticle of a Grand Piano. 

James Thrall Soby, The Exhibition of Salvador Dalí, exh. cat. (New York: The Museum of Modern Art, 1941), 59, cat. 29 (ill.).

James Thrall Soby, Salvador Dalí (New York: The Museum of Modern Art, 1946), 59 (ill.).

A. Reynolds Morse, Michel Tapié, Dalí: a study of his life and work (Greenwich, CT: New York Graphic Society, 1958), cat. 33, 37, 42. 

Pontus Hulten, Salvador Dalí. Retrospective, exh. cat. (Paris: Centre Georges Pompidou, 1979) 199, cat. 141 (ill.).

Pontus Hulten, Ici commence la vie publique de Salvador Dalí, exh. cat. (Paris: Centre Georges Pompidou, 1980), 60.

Simon Wilson, Salvador Dalí, exh. cat. (London: The Tate Gallery, 1980), fig. XXII.	

Josep Pla, Salvador Dalí, obres de museu (Figueres: Dasa Edicones,1981), 35.
	
Jaume Socias, Dalí, Gent Nostra Dalí (Barcelona: Nou Art Thor, 1983), 18 (detail).

Clarà, Dalí, Monturiol, Pla, Vayreda (Barcelona: Nou Art Thor, 1983), 18 (detail).

Robert Descharnes and Gilles Néret, Salvador Dalí, 1904 -1989 (Köln: Benedikt Taschen, 1994), 258, cat. 578 (ill.).

Robert Descharnes and Gilles Néret, Salvador Dalí 1904-1946. The Paintings: 1904-1946 (London: Taschen, 1997), 258, cat. 578 (ill.).

Dawn Ades, Dalí's Optical Illusions, exh. cat. (Hartford, CT: Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 2000), 55 (indirect image).

Lourdes Cirlot and Mercè Vidal, eds., Salvador Dalí i les arts: historiografia i críticia al segle XXI (Barcelona: Publicaciones de la Universitat de Barcelona, 2005), 50, 51, cat. 17 (ill.).

Shaun O’L. Higgins, Colleen Striegel, Press Gallery: The Newspaper in Modern and Postmodern Art (Spokane, WA: New Media Ventures, 2005), cover, 12, 92, cat. 45 (ill.).

Luis Bañel, Un perro andaluz 80 años después (Madrid: Sociedad Estatal de Conmemoraciones Culturales, La Fábrica, 2009), 122.

Frédérique Joseph-Lowery and Charles Stuckey, Salvador Dalí (1904–1989), Drawing for “Bacchanale”. Ludwig II of Bavaria, 1939 (Brussels: Patrick Derom Gallery, 2013), 6, fig. 4.

Jed Rasula, “Wagnerism: A Telephone from the Beyond” Georgia Review 65.2 (Summer 2011), 426.

Salvador Dalí Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings (1910-1964) (Figueras, Spain: Gala-Salvador Dalí Foundation, 2014), cat. 417 (ill.).

Jacqui Palumbo, “Two art curators had a mystery on their hands. Was an unusual Dalí painting actually his?” CNN Style, Feb. 24, 2023 (color ill.), http://edition.cnn.com/style/article/salvador-dali-art-institute-of-chicago-dream-of-venus/index.html
exhibition_history:
New York, Julien Levy Gallery, Souvenir–Catalogue: Dalí paints the invisible straight from nature, Dec. 10, 1936–Jan. 5, 1937 (extended to Jan. 9), cat. 8, as A chemist lifting with precaution the cuticle of a grand piano.

Arts Club of Chicago, Loan Exhibition of Modern Paintings and Drawings from Private Collections in Chicago, Nov. 4–25, 1938, cat. 20, as Physician Lifting with Extreme Precaution the Cuticle of a Grand Piano.

New York, Museum of Modern Art, Salvador Dalí, Nov. 19, 1941–Dec. 18, 1942, no cat. no. (ill.).

Indianapolis, John Herron Art Institute, Exhibition of Paintings by Salvador Dalí, Apr. 5–May 4, 1942, cat. 29.

Paris, Centre Georges Pompidou, Musée national d’art moderne, Salvador Dalí: rétrospective 1920–1980, Dec. 18, 1979–Apr. 21, 1980, cat. 141.

Art Institute of Chicago, The Mr. & Mrs. Joseph Randall Shapiro Collection, Feb. 23–Apr. 14, 1985, cat. 30 (ill.), as A Chemist Lifting with Extreme Caution the Cuticle of a Grand Piano.

Fort Worth, Kimbell Art Museum, The Age of Picasso and Matisse: Modern Masters from the Art Institute of Chicago, Oct. 6, 2013–Feb.16, 2014, no cat. no.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Salvador Dalí: The Image Disappears, Feb. 18–June 12, 2023, no cat.
provenance_text: The artist; Julien Levy Gallery, New York, by Dec. 10, 1936 [New York 1936]; sold to Mr. Thomas Hart Fisher (died 1969) and Mrs. Ruth Page Fisher (died 1991), Chicago, Jan. 1936 until at least 1969 [Julien Levy Gallery ledger, 1929–35, Julien Levy Gallery Records, Philadelphia Museum of Art, Library and Archives; Art Institute of Chicago loan receipt 6173, Jan. 14, 1937 and letter from Thomas Hart Fisher, Apr. 28, 1969; copies in curatorial object file]. Joseph Shapiro (died 1996) and Jory Shapiro (died 1993), Oak Park, IL, by 1985 [Chicago 1985]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1996.

input: A Chemist Lifting with Extreme Precaution the Cuticle of a Grand Piano
